We first assess the FL performance
with similarity-based clustering and with random client selection in a highly heterogeneous scenario with Î²ğ›½\beta\,=â€‰0.050.05\,0.05.
The experimental results in TableÂ I reveal that the number of rounds required to reach convergence in the case of similarity-based clustering is lower compared to the random selection for all metrics.
It is worth noting that
the number of clients per round is not a priori defined, but rather it is determined for each metric using AlgorithmÂ 1 (line 8). A careful inspection of TableÂ I reveals that
energy consumption can be remarkably reduced from 23.93%percent23.9323.93\% to 41.61%percent41.6141.61\% compared to the baseline random selection, for those similarity metrics achieving equivalent number of clients per round (n=10ğ‘›10n=10).

references:
While the performance gains are noticeable for highly heterogeneous scenarios (i.e., low Î²ğ›½\beta), we henceforth explore the feasibility of similarity-based clustering in more homogeneous setups with higher Î²ğ›½\beta. TableÂ II depicts the comparative performance outcomes for similarity-based clustering and random selection for Î²ğ›½\beta\,=â€‰0.10.1\,0.1. In this case, it is noted that only Chebyshev and Manhattan metrics achieve superior performance in terms of both number of rounds and energy consumption compared to random selection for nğ‘›n\,=â€‰1010\,10.
However, we remark here that even though the similarity-based clustering approach does not present such high-performance gains in more homogeneous data distributions, it does not require a priori information on the number of clients to be selected at every round, as in the random approach. This feature represents an added value and poses elevated merit for fast FL deployments in realistic applications. Finally, the performance gains of similarity-based clustering compared to random selection further vanish when Î²ğ›½\beta\,=â€‰22\,2, as shown in
TableÂ III. It is noted, though, that such homogeneous settings are not common in real-world FL scenarios.
